chunks.en: My family was scammed on Kwai (Kuaishou), and it's too difficult to recover the losses.

1: The elderly in my family spent 100,000 RMB on Kwai in the past two years (2023 and 2024), mostly buying 'antiques' and a small portion of health products.
2: I discovered that they deeply believe in the scripted live broadcasts of the anchors on Kwai, believing everything they say, and thus falling into scams such as the temporary custody of antiques by large families, the recycling of old objects, and the auction of antiques.
3: I reported the case, and my uncle said that receiving the goods constitutes a transaction dispute, and suggested filing a lawsuit.
4: Kwai only refunded the deposits that had guarantees. 75% of the merchants' deposits are gone, and we need to contact them ourselves. Basically, we can't get in touch with them.
5: According to the business license, I complained to the market supervision department. The merchants either can't be contacted or say they have no money to compensate. The market supervision bureau also suggested filing a lawsuit.
6: The orders are too scattered, more than 300 orders. The anchors change shops every two broadcasts, and the amount of money in each shop is not high, making it too troublesome to file a lawsuit.
7: The anchor accounts also change every three days. If they are reported, they just change their accounts. The system recommendation mechanism will still push them to fans, and even prepare in advance, diverting traffic to small accounts before they are banned.
8: At this moment, these people are still broadcasting and selling goods, some on Kwai, and some have been diverted to WeChat. Reporting to WeChat is also like a stone sinking into the sea, and it doesn't affect their daily live broadcast harvesting of these elderly people at all.
9: According to my observation, there are hundreds of thousands of similar victims. CCTV has also reported it, but I don't know why no one cares.
It's all your fault. If you were leeching off your parents at home, they wouldn't have money to be scammed by others.

chunks.en: @hallostr What is there to reflect on? I went to work. The elderly in my family have some living expenses and free time. My family watched a short video at home, bought something, and were instigated by the anchor to hide the things because bad people would come to steal them. What should I reflect on? Don't leave money for the elderly? Don't go to work and stay with my family every day? Don't let them watch short videos on legitimate platforms? Why are you reflection monsters so demanding of ordinary people?

Recently, there has been a batch of fake hard drives on Xianyu, mostly female avatars, 2T, 4T, and 6T hard drives selling for 100-160 RMB. I have reported and removed more than 100 of them in a row. For this kind of thing that is specifically played with massive accounts, you can't catch the source fake manufacturers to report.
@hallostr #20 OP's family's elderly were scammed, and they are in a bad mood and want to vent to everyone. You suddenly said why not reflect on it, which is really hard to hold back :-|
I read every word carefully and didn't see a single word about self/elderly reflection.
@hallostr #20 Sure enough, the tag was not assigned to the wrong person.
@hallostr Either spreading rumors or being a reflection monster. https://www.v2ex.com/t/1113620

It's not just the elderly, there are also many young people who are scammed when buying paintings. The 'Zi Jin who loves to draw' on Douyin uses software to Photoshop oil painting filters on photos every time. The line drafts are also extracted with software, and then the process of pretending to be hand-painted is reversed, but the facial details suddenly become the same as the photo. There is never any facial painting process, the face positioning perfectly coincides with the photo (occasionally the photo shown is another one). Without the photo, he would never be able to draw such a precise face. Tens of thousands of people have ordered paintings in the shop...

@CodeGou Then you don't reflect, remembering the past is a guide to the future. Although the other party is so bad, in the end you have to bear the cost yourself. Regardless of responsibility, I said you can't be kind online, some people just don't listen to advice and maliciously speculate about the good intentions of others. It's harmful, and instead they say others are reflection monsters, and as soon as you go along with their idea, they start attacking you personally.
Posted on Linux do once, and then on V2 again ğŸ¤™
I suggest taking the elderly to the 'Listening to Spring Appraising Treasures' program.
They paid the protection fee. Really, many people can generate revenue.
I don't dare to leave money in the hands of the elderly. I take all the money in their bank cards and give them cash as living expenses every month.
@julyclyde With this awareness, the scam gang will be laughing their heads off.

Don't give the elderly too much money. In other words, 'fraud' is the redistribution of money that does not match intelligence. The older generation's cognition cannot control so much money. Give him a little pocket money every month, call SF Express to prohibit sending cash on delivery; open a little intimate payment on WeChat and Alipay.

The problem of the elderly being scammed is very difficult to deal with. Now it's Kwai, but before Kwai, weren't all kinds of offline health product marketing scams? But this may be difficult to manage, it's not like they don't give things, it's just that the price is expensive, can you prohibit things from being expensive? The only way I can think of is to try to keep an eye on it, communicate well with parents, and if possible, look after their money, or even buy something really valuable to lock them in.

@ffxxzz It's useless. Do you know Lao Ge from Taiyuan? He is a well-known scammer, selling fake gold labels and resurrection necklaces, and now he looks like the top brother on Kwai. Moreover, CCTV has already reported on related scams, and the victims in the news who lost hundreds of thousands of yuan were also eventually kicked back to contact the merchants themselves. Kwai is perfectly hidden. Kwai is just a platform where sellers sell goods, the platform takes commissions, consumers defend their rights, the platform deducts deposits, and if the merchants have no deposits, the platform says that the merchants and consumers should handle it themselves, and the platform does not bear any responsibility.

Take care of the elderly in your own family. Don't rely on your uncle to take care of the government. Serving the people is just a slogan. If it could really be achieved, there would be no need to shout it every day. Don't expect scammers to disappear from the world. Sheep also hope that wolves will be extinct, but this world is not built on your hopes. Adults should have more mature cognition.

1. The account is useless, change the elderly's mobile phone number. 2. Unbind the bank card from the mobile app, only give cash, and let them go to the offline store to buy, although it's a bit more expensive, it's better than being scammed. 3. Bind WeChat/Alipay with Family Payment, don't bind the elderly's card, set a monthly limit, and payment will fail if it exceeds the limit. 4. You personally pay for large expenses.
If you can't change the environment, you can only change yourself. It's a bit speechless that the elderly are still justified after being scammed.
